docs.text: Crdc-H schema Classes CDM.BiologicallyDerivedProduct - A living organism, or a metabolocally active biological system such as a cell culture, tissue culture, or organoid that is maintained or propagated in vitro. CDM.Exposure - Contact between an agent and a target. A state of contact or close proximity to a medicinal product, chemical, pathogen, radioisotope or other substance. CDM.Organization - A grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose such as a data coordinating center, an university, or an institute within a university CDM.Patient - Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services. CDM.Report CDM.ResearchProject - A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge. CDM.ResearchSubject - A research subject is the entity of interest in a research study, typically a human being or an animal, but can also be a device, group of humans or animals, CDM.Specimen - Any material taken as a sample from a biological entity (living or dead), or from a physical object or the environment. Specimens are usually collected as an example of their kind, often for use in some investigation. CDM.SpecimenContainer CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity - The process of creating a specimen through observing and/or removing material from an biological source or natural setting (e.g. from a person, animal, cell line, or environmental material), or through derivation from an existing specimen (e.g. through portioning or aliquoting). This activity represents the entire process up to the point where the specimen is physically modified, stored, or transported. CDM.SpecimenProcessingActivity CDM.SpecimenStorageActivity - A vessel in which a specimen is held or attached - to store or as a substrate for growth (e.g. a cell culture dish) or analysis (e.g. a microscope slide or 96-well plate) CDM.SpecimenTransportActivity - An activity through which a specimen is transported between locations. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞passage_number - When the specimen an actively growing model system, such as a cell or tissue culture, this property captures its passage number. ➞product_type - The high level type of model system (e.g. cell line, cell culture, tissue culture, organoid) ➞alcohol_use - A container holding a set of observations about an individual's exposure to alcohol. ➞environmental - Observations about an individual's exposure to environmental substances that may impact clinical outcomes. ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. ➞related_patient - A reference to the Patient that is the subject of this Exposure ➞tobacco_use - A container holding a set of observations about an individual's exposure to tobacco. ➞alias - A secondary name for the organization such as a short name or abbreviation (e.g. 'NCI') ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. ➞name - The full legal name by which the organization is known (e.g. 'National Cancer Institute') ➞organization_type - The type of the organization (e.g. 'Cancer Genome Characterization Center') ➞adverse_events - A reference to the AdverseEvent(s) experienced by this Patient ➞given_name - The given name for the patient, likely only applicable in non-human use cases given HIPAA restrictions on sharing of PII ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. ➞taxon - The taxonomic group (e.g. species) of the patient. ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞date_ended - The date when the research project ended. ➞date_iacuc_approval - The date that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) approved an animal study protocol. This date cannot be released to funding agencies until congruency between the animal use in the funding proposal and the IACUC approved protocol has been verified. ➞date_started - The date when the research project began. ➞description - An unabridged description of a research program, project, or study. ➞description_shortened - An abbreviated description of a research program, project, or study. ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. ➞name - An unabridged name of a research program, project, or study. ➞name_shortened - An abbreviated name of a research program, project, or study. ➞part_of - A reference to a parent ResearchProject (e.g. a link to the overarching CPTAC ResearchProject from a substudy of CPTAC) ➞primary_anatomic_site - The text term used to describe the general location of the malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). ➞research_project_type - The 'type' of ResearchProject represented (e.g. a broad-based Program like 'CPTAC' or a more focused Project like 'CPTAC PDAC Discovery Study') ➞sponsor - An entity that is responsible for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a research project. ➞url - A URL address for a resource that provides information about a research program, project, or study. ➞associated_patient - A reference to the Patient that is this ResearchSubject ➞associated_project - A reference to the Project(s) in which this ResearchSubject participates ➞description - A free text field to capture additional info/explanation about the research subject. ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. ➞index_timepoint - The text term used to describe the reference or anchor date used for date obfuscation, where a single date is obscured by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date. ➞member_of_cohort - A reference to the Cohort(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member ➞member_of_study - A reference to the Study(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member ➞originating_site - A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use. ➞primary_disease_site - The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories. ➞primary_disease_type - The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). ➞processed_at - The site at which a biospecimen entity was processed. ➞qualification_status_flag - Specifies if the ResearchSubject is qualified or disqualified for any reason. Usually the data related to such ResearchSubjects may be not used in the data analysis ➞reference_status_flag - A biospecimen entity which is used as a reference sample for determining relative protein abundances in labeling experiments. ➞study_progress - A data container holding information about the various states through which a ResearchSubject may pass during the course of their participation in a ResearchStudy ➞additive - A material substance added to the container. ➞charge_type - A descripton of the type of charge on a slide on which a specimen is mounted ➞container_number - Informal number/identifier by which the container is referenced (e.g. a slide number, or a well number in a plate) ➞container_type - The kind of container associated with the specimen. ➞parent_container - A larger container of which this container is a part (e.g. a single well in a 96-well plate) ➞activity_type - The high-level type of creation activity ➞collected_during_visit - A specific visit during which the specimen was collected. ➞collection_site - A data container holding information about the anatomic source of a specimen, including its location in the body, and the approach route used to access it. ➞date_ended - The date when the activity ended (in this case, a specimen creation event). ➞date_started - The date when the activity began (in this case, a specimen creation event). ➞execution_condition - Information describing the specified or observed conditions under which activity was executed ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞input_specimen - One or more existing specimens input into the specimen creation activity, from which a new specimen is derived (e.g. through portioning, aliquoting, sectioning, etc) ➞method_type - A specific type of method followed in performing the creation activity. ➞performed_by - The organization or group that performed the activity. ➞quantity_collected - The quantity of material in the specimen as originally collected from its original source material (prior to downstream portioning or processing) ➞relative_order - A numeric value that represents the sequential order of this collection process relative to that of collection processes producing specimens from the same source material or parent specimen. ➞relative_timing - The timing of the activity relative to some other activity or timepoint. ➞duration - The length of time over which the activity was performed. ➞performed_by - The organization or group that performed the activity. ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞date_ended - The date when the activity ended (in this case, a transport event). ➞date_started - The date when the activity began (in this case, a transport event). ➞execution_conditions - An environmental condition under which the activity is executed (in this case, a transport activity). ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞transport_destination - An organization (facility, site, lab, etc) to which the specimen is delivered as a result of the activity. ➞analyte_type - For speciemens of type 'analyte' (or an 'aliquot' derived from an analyte), this is the category of chemcial the analyte of interest represents (e.g. DNA, RNA) ➞associated_project - The Project associated with the specimen. ➞cellular_composition_measure - An observation that quantifies the realative or absolute composition of a specimen at cellular level, - i.e. how many cells in the specimen are of a given type, or exhibit a particular cellular phenotype. This information is typically determined through microscopic analysis of a slide. ➞cellular_composition_type - A term describing the type of material comprising a specimen at a celluar level. ➞condition_status_at_collection - The status of a patient's condition at the time the speimen was collected (e.g. if it was primary, recurrent, metastatic, etc). ➞contained_in - A physical container in which a specimen is held or attached - as storage for future use, a substrate for growth (e.g. a cell culture dish), or a vessel to enable analysis (e.g. a microscope slide or 96-well plate) ➞creation_activity - An activity or procedure through which a specimen was created, through removing material from an biological subject, or deriving material from an existing specimen. ➞derived_product - A 'living' biologically active product (e.g. a cell culture, tissue culture, or organoid) that was generated from the specimen ➞description - A free text field to capture additional information or explanation about the specimen. ➞dimensional_measure - An observation about the dimensions of an object, including lengths, areas, and volumes. ➞general_tissue_morphology - A term describing at a high-level the kind of tissue collected in a specimen, with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue (e.g. is it normal, abnormal, tumor, tumor-adjacent). ➞id - The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that us globally unique and persists across implementing systems. ➞matched_normal_flag - A flag indicating that there is no matched normal aliquot for this case that can be used for variant calling purposes. ➞paired_specimen_genotype_match_flag - A flag to indicate whether the genotype of the paired normal or tumor specimen matches, or if the data is not available. ➞parent_specimen - An existing specimen from which the specimen of interest was directly derived (i.e its immediate parent specimen). ➞processing_activity - An activity that modifies the physical structure, composition, or state of a specimen. ➞provided_by - The organization/center that provided the specimen. ➞qualification_status_flag - A flag indicating whether the specimen is qualified or disqualified for data analysis in a study. ➞quality_measure - An observation about specimen characteristics indicative of its quality or suitability for use. ➞quantity_measure - An observation related to the current quantity of a specimen or analyte it contains - e.g. its weight, volume, or concentration. ➞reference_status_flag - A flag indicating whether the specimen is used as a reference during analytical interrogation ➞related_diagnosis - A patient diagnosis that was informed by a pathological assessment of the specimen [➞related_document? related_report? ](cDM.Specimen__related_document?_related_report?.md) - A reference to an external document that is about or related to the specimen (e.g. a publication related to the study it is a part of, pathology report containing additional details about it, protocol describing how it was collected, or a catalog entry describing related research resource) * ➞related_specimen - Another specimen to which this one is related in some way (excluding parent-child / derivation relationships, which are captured using the dedicated the source_specimen field) * ➞section_location - The location in a parent specimen from which a section/portion was excised (e.g. top, middle, bottom) * ➞selected_normal_flag - A flag to denote which 'normal' aliquot the submitter prefers to use for variant calling. Only one normal per experimental strategy per case can be selected. * ➞source_material_type - The general kind of material from which the specimen was derived, based on the physical nature of the source material. * ➞source_model_system - A Biologically Derived Material / model system (e.g. a cell line, tissue culture, organoid) from which a specimen was directly or indirectly derived. * ➞source_patient - A Patient from which the specimen was directly or indirectly derived. * ➞specific_tissue_morphology - A term describing the specific pathology exhibited by the tissue in a specimen. * ➞specimen_type - The high-level type of the specimen, based on its derivation provenance (i.e. how far removed it is from the original sample extracted from a source). * ➞storage_activity - An activity that results in the storage or maintenance of a specimen in a particular location, container, or state. * ➞tissue_composition_measure - An observation about the absolute area or relative proportion of a specific type of tissue in a specimen or other biological material * ➞transport_activity - An activity through which the specimen is transported between locations. Enums Types Built in Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str Defined Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE

The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. ➞identifier - A 'business' identifier or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that us globally unique and persists across implementing systems. ➞matched_normal_flag - A flag indicating that there is no matched normal aliquot for this case that can be used for variant calling purposes. ➞paired_specimen_genotype_match_flag - A flag to indicate whether the genotype of the paired normal or tumor specimen matches, or if the data is not available. ➞parent_specimen - An existing specimen from which the specimen of interest was directly derived (i.e its immediate parent specimen). ➞processing_activity - An activity that modifies the physical structure, composition, or state of a specimen. ➞provided_by - The organization/center that provided the specimen. ➞qualification_status_flag - A flag indicating whether the specimen is qualified or disqualified for data analysis in a study. ➞quality_measure - An observation about specimen characteristics indicative of its quality or suitability for use. ➞quantity_measure - An observation related to the current quantity of a specimen or analyte it contains - e.g. its weight, volume, or concentration. ➞reference_status_flag - A flag indicating whether the specimen is used as a reference during analytical interrogation ➞related_diagnosis - A patient diagnosis that was informed by a pathological assessment of the specimen [➞related_document? related_report? ](cDM.Specimen__related_document?_related_report?.md) - A reference to an external document that is about or related to the specimen (e.g. a publication related to the study it is a part of, pathology report containing additional details about it, protocol describing how it was collected, or a catalog entry describing related research resource) * ➞related_specimen - Another specimen to which this one is related in some way (excluding parent-child / derivation relationships, which are captured using the dedicated the source_specimen field) * ➞section_location - The location in a parent specimen from which a section/portion was excised (e.g. top, middle, bottom) * ➞selected_normal_flag - A flag to denote which 'normal' aliquot the submitter prefers to use for variant calling. Only one normal per experimental strategy per case can be selected. * ➞source_material_type - The general kind of material from which the specimen was derived, based on the physical nature of the source material. * ➞source_model_system - A Biologically Derived Material / model system (e.g. a cell line, tissue culture, organoid) from which a specimen was directly or indirectly derived. * ➞source_patient - A Patient from which the specimen was directly or indirectly derived. * ➞specific_tissue_morphology - A term describing the specific pathology exhibited by the tissue in a specimen. * ➞specimen_type - The high-level type of the specimen, based on its derivation provenance (i.e. how far removed it is from the original sample extracted from a source). * ➞storage_activity - An activity that results in the storage or maintenance of a specimen in a particular location, container, or state. * ➞tissue_composition_measure - An observation about the absolute area or relative proportion of a specific type of tissue in a specimen or other biological material * ➞transport_activity - An activity through which the specimen is transported between locations.

docs.text: Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE

docs.text: Class: CDM.ResearchProject A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge. This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies and other interventional and investigative techniques. A ResearchProject involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects. URI: ccdh:CDM.ResearchProject Attributes Own ➞date_ended OPT Description: The date when the research project ended. range: String ➞date_iacuc_approval OPT Description: The date that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) approved an animal study protocol. This date cannot be released to funding agencies until congruency between the animal use in the funding proposal and the IACUC approved protocol has been verified. range: String ➞date_started OPT Description: The date when the research project began. range: String ➞description OPT Description: An unabridged description of a research program, project, or study. range: String ➞description_shortened OPT Description: An abbreviated description of a research program, project, or study. range: String ➞id OPT Description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. range: String ➞identifier 0..* Description: A 'business' identifier or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. range: String ➞name OPT Description: An unabridged name of a research program, project, or study. range: String ➞name_shortened OPT Description: An abbreviated name of a research program, project, or study. range: String ➞part_of 0..* Description: A reference to a parent ResearchProject (e.g. a link to the overarching CPTAC ResearchProject from a substudy of CPTAC) range: String ➞primary_anatomic_site 0..* Description: The text term used to describe the general location of the malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). range: String ➞research_project_type REQ Description: The 'type' of ResearchProject represented (e.g. a broad-based Program like 'CPTAC' or a more focused Project like 'CPTAC PDAC Discovery Study') range: String ➞sponsor 0..* Description: An entity that is responsible for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a research project. range: String ➞url 0..* Description: A URL address for a resource that provides information about a research program, project, or study. range: String Other properties See also: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oWS7cao-fgz2MKWtyr8h2dEL9unX__0bJrWKv6mQmM4/edit#gid=1123416579

docs.text: Class: CDM.ResearchSubject A research subject is the entity of interest in a research study, typically a human being or an animal, but can also be a device, group of humans or animals, or a tissue sample. Human research subjects are usually not traceable to a particular person to protect the subject’s privacy. URI: ccdh:CDM.ResearchSubject Attributes Own ➞associated_patient REQ Description: A reference to the Patient that is this ResearchSubject range: String ➞associated_project 0..* Description: A reference to the Project(s) in which this ResearchSubject participates range: String ➞description OPT Description: A free text field to capture additional info/explanation about the research subject. range: String ➞id REQ Description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. range: String ➞identifier 0..* Description: A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems. range: String ➞index_timepoint OPT Description: The text term used to describe the reference or anchor date used for date obfuscation, where a single date is obscured by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date. range: String ➞member_of_cohort 0..* Description: A reference to the Cohort(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member range: String ➞member_of_study 0..* Description: A reference to the Study(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member range: String ➞originating_site OPT Description: A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use. range: String ➞primary_disease_site OPT Description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories. range: String ➞primary_disease_type OPT Description: The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). range: String ➞processed_at OPT Description: The site at which a biospecimen entity was processed. range: String ➞qualification_status_flag OPT Description: Specifies if the ResearchSubject is qualified or disqualified for any reason. Usually the data related to such ResearchSubjects may be not used in the data analysis range: String ➞reference_status_flag OPT Description: A biospecimen entity which is used as a reference sample for determining relative protein abundances in labeling experiments. range: String ➞study_progress 0..* Description: A data container holding information about the various states through which a ResearchSubject may pass during the course of their participation in a ResearchStudy range: String Other properties See also: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oWS7cao-fgz2MKWtyr8h2dEL9unX__0bJrWKv6mQmM4/edit#gid=665511119

docs.text: Class: CDM.Specimen Any material taken as a sample from a biological entity (living or dead), or from a physical object or the environment. Specimens are usually collected as an example of their kind, often for use in some investigation. URI: ccdh:CDM.Specimen Attributes Own ➞analyte_type OPT Description: For speciemens of type 'analyte' (or an 'aliquot' derived from an analyte), this is the category of chemcial the analyte of interest represents (e.g. DNA, RNA) range: String ➞associated_project OPT Description: The Project associated with the specimen. range: String ➞cellular_composition_measure 0..* Description: An observation that quantifies the realative or absolute composition of a specimen at cellular level, - i.e. how many cells in the specimen are of a given type, or exhibit a particular cellular phenotype. This information is typically determined through microscopic analysis of a slide. range: String ➞cellular_composition_type OPT Description: A term describing the type of material comprising a specimen at a celluar level. range: String ➞condition_status_at_collection OPT Description: The status of a patient's condition at the time the speimen was collected (e.g. if it was primary, recurrent, metastatic, etc). range: String ➞contained_in OPT Description: A physical container in which a specimen is held or attached - as storage for future use, a substrate for growth (e.g. a cell culture dish), or a vessel to enable analysis (e.g. a microscope slide or 96-well plate) range: String ➞creation_activity OPT Description: An activity or procedure through which a specimen was created, through removing material from an biological subject, or deriving material from an existing specimen. range: String ➞derived_product 0..* Description: A 'living' biologically active product (e.g. a cell culture, tissue culture, or organoid) that was generated from the specimen range: String ➞description OPT Description: A free text field to capture additional information or explanation about the specimen. range: String ➞dimensional_measure OPT Description: An observation about the dimensions of an object, including lengths, areas, and volumes. range: String ➞general_tissue_morphology OPT Description: A term describing at a high-level the kind of tissue collected in a specimen, with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue (e.g. is it normal, abnormal, tumor, tumor-adjacent). range: String ➞id OPT Description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. range: String ➞identifier 0..* Description: A 'business' identifier or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that us globally unique and persists across implementing systems. range: String ➞matched_normal_flag 0..* Description: A flag indicating that there is no matched normal aliquot for this case that can be used for variant calling purposes. range: String ➞paired_specimen_genotype_match_flag OPT Description: A flag to indicate whether the genotype of the paired normal or tumor specimen matches, or if the data is not available. range: String ➞parent_specimen 0..* Description: An existing specimen from which the specimen of interest was directly derived (i.e its immediate parent specimen). range: String ➞processing_activity 0..* Description: An activity that modifies the physical structure, composition, or state of a specimen. range: String ➞provided_by OPT Description: The organization/center that provided the specimen. range: String ➞qualification_status_flag OPT Description: A flag indicating whether the specimen is qualified or disqualified for data analysis in a study. range: String ➞quality_measure 0..* Description: An observation about specimen characteristics indicative of its quality or suitability for use. range: String ➞quantity_measure 0..* Description: An observation related to the current quantity of a specimen or analyte it contains - e.g. its weight, volume, or concentration. range: String ➞reference_status_flag OPT Description: A flag indicating whether the specimen is used as a reference during analytical interrogation range: String ➞related_diagnosis 0..* Description: A patient diagnosis that was informed by a pathological assessment of the specimen range: String [➞related_document? related_report? ](cDM.Specimen__related_document?_related_report?.md) 0.. * Description: A reference to an external document that is about or related to the specimen (e.g. a publication related to the study it is a part of, pathology report containing additional details about it, protocol describing how it was collected, or a catalog entry describing related research resource) * range: String * ➞related_specimen 0.. * Description: Another specimen to which this one is related in some way (excluding parent-child / derivation relationships, which are captured using the dedicated the source_specimen field) * range: String * ➞section_location OPT * Description: The location in a parent specimen from which a section/portion was excised (e.g. top, middle, bottom) * range: String * ➞selected_normal_flag OPT * Description: A flag to denote which 'normal' aliquot the submitter prefers to use for variant calling. Only one normal per experimental strategy per case can be selected. * range: String * ➞source_material_type OPT * Description: The general kind of material from which the specimen was derived, based on the physical nature of the source material. * range: String * ➞source_model_system OPT * Description: A Biologically Derived Material / model system (e.g. a cell line, tissue culture, organoid) from which a specimen was directly or indirectly derived. * range: String * ➞source_patient OPT * Description: A Patient from which the specimen was directly or indirectly derived. * range: String * ➞specific_tissue_morphology OPT * Description: A term describing the specific pathology exhibited by the tissue in a specimen. * range: String * ➞specimen_type OPT * Description: The high-level type of the specimen, based on its derivation provenance (i.e. how far removed it is from the original sample extracted from a source). * range: [String](types/String.md) ➞storage_activity OPT Description: An activity that results in the storage or maintenance of a specimen in a particular location, container, or state. range: String ➞tissue_composition_measure 0..* Description: An observation about the absolute area or relative proportion of a specific type of tissue in a specimen or other biological material range: String ➞transport_activity OPT Description: An activity through which the specimen is transported between locations. range: String Other properties Comments: Definition adapted from FHIR.Specimen. See also: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oWS7cao-fgz2MKWtyr8h2dEL9unX__0bJrWKv6mQmM4/edit#gid=1439310281
docs.title: Class: CDM.Specimen

docs.text: Any material taken as a sample from a biological entity (living or dead), or from a physical object or the environment. Specimens are usually collected as an example of their kind, often for use in some investigation. URI: ccdh:CDM.Specimen

docs.text: Class: CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity The process of creating a specimen through observing and/or removing material from an biological source or natural setting (e.g. from a person, animal, cell line, or environmental material), or through derivation from an existing specimen (e.g. through portioning or aliquoting). This activity represents the entire process up to the point where the specimen is physically modified, stored, or transported. URI: ccdh:CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity Attributes Own ➞activity_type OPT Description: The high-level type of creation activity range: String ➞collected_during_visit OPT Description: A specific visit during which the specimen was collected. range: String ➞collection_site OPT Description: A data container holding information about the anatomic source of a specimen, including its location in the body, and the approach route used to access it. range: String ➞date_ended OPT Description: The date when the activity ended (in this case, a specimen creation event). range: String ➞date_started OPT Description: The date when the activity began (in this case, a specimen creation event). range: String ➞execution_condition 0..* Description: Information describing the specified or observed conditions under which activity was executed range: String ➞id OPT Description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record. This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it. range: String ➞input_specimen 0..* Description: One or more existing specimens input into the specimen creation activity, from which a new specimen is derived (e.g. through portioning, aliquoting, sectioning, etc) range: String ➞method_type OPT Description: A specific type of method followed in performing the creation activity. range: String ➞performed_by OPT Description: The organization or group that performed the activity. range: String ➞quantity_collected OPT Description: The quantity of material in the specimen as originally collected from its original source material (prior to downstream portioning or processing) range: String ➞relative_order OPT Description: A numeric value that represents the sequential order of this collection process relative to that of collection processes producing specimens from the same source material or parent specimen. range: String ➞relative_timing 0..* Description: The timing of the activity relative to some other activity or timepoint. range: String Other properties See also: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oWS7cao-fgz2MKWtyr8h2dEL9unX__0bJrWKv6mQmM4/edit#gid=693792130

docs.text: Slot: cDM.SpecimenCreationActivity__date_started The date when the activity began (in this case, a specimen creation event). URI: ccdh:cDM.SpecimenCreationActivity__date_started Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents Children Used by CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity Other properties Comments: For our purposes, dates can be expressed explicitly as a single date (e.g. "2012-04-09") or a period spanning many days (e.g. "2012-04-09 - "2012-04-12"), or as an offset from some index date (e.g. "55 days from index"), for purposes of obfuscating patient identity. The t.b.d. DateTime data type will need to be capable of expressing a date in these different ways.

docs.text: Slot: cDM.Specimen__identifier A 'business' identifier or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that us globally unique and persists across implementing systems. URI: ccdh:cDM.Specimen__identifier Domain and Range None -> 0..* String Parents Children Used by CDM.Specimen Other properties Comments: FHIR naming conventions are followed here, where 'id' is used for logical identifiers, and 'identifier' for business identifiers. The complex 'Identifier' data type is used to capture the identifier itself, along with metadata about the source of the business identifier. Typically, identifiers are used to connect content in resources to external content available in other frameworks or protocols.

docs.text: Slot: cDM.Specimen__matched_normal_flag A flag indicating that there is no matched normal aliquot for this case that can be used for variant calling purposes. URI: ccdh:cDM.Specimen__matched_normal_flag Domain and Range None -> 0..* String Parents Children Used by CDM.Specimen Other properties Comments: This attribute comes from GDC, where it is specific to 'aliquot' specimens. If we leave this as a separate attribute with an enum data type, values will have to indicate whether the variant calling strategy is for targeted, whole genome, or exome sequencing (e.g. "no matched normal wgs"). But as noted above we may ultimately group with with other 'flag'-like attributes into a common structure, where we can deal with this issue.
docs.title: Slot: cDM.Specimen__matched_normal_flag

docs.text: Slot: cDM.Specimen__specimen_type The high-level type of the specimen, based on its derivation provenance (i.e. how far removed it is from the original sample extracted from a source). URI: ccdh:cDM.Specimen__specimen_type Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents Children Used by CDM.Specimen Other properties Comments: Our model definies a single 'Specimen' type to cover speific subtypes of specimens delineated in some CRDC node models (e.g. GDC 'Sample', 'Portion', 'Aliquot', 'Analyte', and 'Slide'). The 'specimen_type' field is used to indicate which subtype a given Specimen instance represents. The enumerated values are meant to be mutually exclusive, such that only one can be applied to a given specimen.

docs.text: Comments: Our model definies a single 'Specimen' type to cover speific subtypes of specimens delineated in some CRDC node models (e.g. GDC 'Sample', 'Portion', 'Aliquot', 'Analyte', and 'Slide'). The 'specimen_type' field is used to indicate which subtype a given Specimen instance represents. The enumerated values are meant to be mutually exclusive, such that only one can be applied to a given specimen.
